sect2.title: Introduction to Cyrus SASL
sect2.para: The Cyrus SASL package contains a Simple Authentication and Security Layer, a method for adding authentication support to connection-based protocols. To use SASL, a protocol includes a command for identifying and authenticating a user to a server and for optionally negotiating protection of subsequent protocol interactions. If its use is negotiated, a security layer is inserted between the protocol and the connection.

sect2.title: Installation of Cyrus SASL
sect2.para: Install Cyrus SASL by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc \ --with-dbpath=/var/lib/sasl/sasldb2 \ --with-saslauthd=/var/run && make && make install && install -m644 saslauthd/saslauthd.mdoc \ /usr/share/man/man8/saslauthd.8 && install -d -m755 /usr/share/doc/sasl && install -m644 doc/{*.{html,txt,fig},ONEWS,TODO} \ saslauthd/LDAP_SASLAUTHD /usr/share/doc/sasl && install -d -m700 /var/lib/sasl

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --with-dbpath=/var/lib/sasl/sasldb2: This parameter forces the saslauthd database to be created in /var/lib/sasl instead of /etc.
--with-saslauthd=/var/run: This parameter forces saslauthd to use the FHS compliant directory /var/run for variable run-time data.
install -m644 ...: These commands install documentation which is not installed by the make install command.
install -d -m700 /var/lib/sasl: This directory must exist when starting saslauthd. If you're not going to be running the daemon, you may omit the creation of this directory.

sect3.title: Config Files
sect3.para: /etc/saslauthd.conf (for LDAP configuration) and /usr/lib/sasl2/Appname.conf (where "Appname" is the application defined name of the application)

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: See for information on what to include in the application configuration files. See for configuring saslauthd with LDAP.

sect3.title: Init Script
sect3.para: If you need to run the saslauthd daemon at system startup, install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/cyrus-sasl init script included in the package.

note.para: You'll need to modify the init script and replace the [authmech] parameter to the -a switch with your desired authentication mechanism.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Cyrus SASL package contains saslauthd, sasldblistusers2, saslpasswd2, Cyrus SASL plugins, the libsasl2 library and optionally the libjavasasl library and SASL Java classes.

sect3.title: saslauthd
sect3.para: saslauthd is the SASL authentication server.

sect3.title: sasldblistusers2
sect3.para: sasldblistusers2 is used to list the users in the SASL password database.

sect3.title: saslpasswd2
sect3.para: saslpasswd2 is used to set and delete a user's SASL password and mechanism specific secrets in the SASL password database.
